content.1: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,
content.2: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.
content.3: But he answered and said unto them,
content.4: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.
content.5: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to
content.6: And honour not his father or his mother,
content.8: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with
content.9: But in vain they do worship me, teaching
content.10: And he called the multitude, and said unto them,
content.11: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.
content.12: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?
content.14: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.
content.15: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.
content.17: Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?
content.18: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.
content.19: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:
content.21: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.
content.22: And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord,
content.23: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.
content.25: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
content.27: And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.
content.28: Then Jesus answered and said unto her,
content.29: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.
content.30: And great multitudes came unto him, having with them
content.31: Insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.
content.33: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?
content.35: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
content.36: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake
content.37: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken
content.38: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.
content.39: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
